page.title: 04HAMPERDEN END VILLAGE
page.content: The village used to be known as{ {Amberden End.}There are only 12 houses there.There are no shops or Post Office,the nearest shop is at{Henham. There is a bus once a week to take people shopping.The{mobile library stops at{Debden Green}and the people of Hamperden End have to go there to it.There is a{mobile fish shop}which goes through the village.There is no school at Hamperden End and the Local Authority hires a taxi to take the children to{Debden School.}The nearest petrol station is at Debden Green.It is very quiet, there are no play areas for the children and no local employment unless it is on a farm. The advantages of living in such a small place are that the houses are {not overlooked}and very secluded.There is a lot of nature to be seen,lots of small woods and{deer}are not uncommon.
